key_points: Rory McIlroy discussed Tiger Woods' condition on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, indicating Woods may soon recover at home.
Tiger Woods was involved in a severe car accident in California last month, resulting in emergency surgery for significant orthopedic injuries to his right lower extremity.
McIlroy has communicated with Woods post-accident and reports that Woods is 'doing better'.
There is hope that Woods could return home in the next week or so to continue his recovery, a move that would allow him to be with his family and children.
McIlroy and other golfers are wishing Woods a speedy recovery during this time.
Woods is still engaged with the PGA Tour, even providing McIlroy with feedback on his performance at the Arnold Palmer Invitational.
Several golfers honored Woods by wearing his signature red shirt and black pants during the final round of the WGC-Workday Championship.
This act of solidarity was meant to send Woods a message of support and hope for his swift return to golf.
McIlroy expresses a collective desire among players to see Woods recover and return to golfing.
Tiger Woods has not yet commented publicly on his current condition following the crash.
